contemplated leaving, even after Dick Cheney told him that he had to stay. In May 2004, when Bush visited the Pentagon and then repaired to Donald Rumsfeld 's office, the secretary handed him yet another I-quit letter. I have concluded that the damage from the acts of abuse that happened on my watch, by individuals for whose conduct I am ultimately responsible, can best be responded to by my resignation, it said. Bush rejected the idea. Donald Rumsfeld said his mind was made up. But Bush would not accept the resignation, and Donald Rumsfeld says he eventually accepted the decision. To no one
